name: Hurt
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
Note: to play the chorus correctly and simulate the piano playing, keep the G on the third fret of the
high e string fretted with your pinky. This makes the chords G major, Am7, Fadd9, and C major.
I also suggest playing a Hendrix Fadd9, so wrap your thumb and play 1st fret low E string.

The strum pattern for Intro/Verse/Transition is picked for the downs and strummed for the ups.
I suggest picking the A and D strings, and then up strum.


[Intro]

[ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]


[Verse 1]

[ch]Am[/ch]   [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]     [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
   I hurt myself today   to see if I still feel
  [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]
I focus on the pain   the only thing that's real
    [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
The needle tears a hole   the old familiar sting
       [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]          
Try to kill it all away   but I remember everything


[Chorus]

[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]
What have I become?     My sweetest friend
[ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]
Everyone I know  goes away in the end
    [ch]Am[/ch]                 [ch]F[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]
And you could have it all   My empire of dirt
[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]
I will let you down    I will make you hurt


[Transition]

([ch]Am[/ch])   [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]


[Verse 2]

[ch]Am[/ch]   [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
   I wear this crown of thorns   upon my liar's chair
[ch]C[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]    [ch]Am[/ch]
Full of broken thoughts   I cannot repair
  [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
Beneath the stains of time   the feelings disappear
[ch]C[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]
You are someone else   I am still right here


[Chorus 2]

[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]
What have I become?     My sweetest friend
[ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]
Everyone I know  goes away in the end
    [ch]Am[/ch]                 [ch]F[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]G[/ch]
And you could have it all   My empire of dirt
[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]     [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]
I will let you down   I will make you hurt
   [ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]F[/ch]     [ch]G[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]
If I could start again  a million miles away
[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]
I would keep myself  I would find a way

I have taken the best of the previous versions and put them together the way I like to
play the song. I've also fixed the chord issue to sound more like the recording.

4/4 Time
*Notes within “()” are to be played very lightly

In the intro play both lines.  For the verses, play only the second line and repeat the
second line four times as indicated in chord progression.  For the transition, add some
light notes to the first two Am finger patterns.  For example:

   [ch]Am[/ch]                                   
e||------0-(0)-----|
B||------1-(1)-----|
G||------2-(2)-----|
D||----2-----------|
A||--0-------------|
E||----------------|

Throughout all the chords in the chorus you can keep your pinky on the high G note (e
string 3rd fret) to capture the note the piano is playing in the background if you want
a more authentic/full sound.  There should be four accented down strums for each chord
with a light bass note of each chord played in between each strum.

strumming pattern for the chorus.

6th string.  This is a great song enjoy.

content.text:
[Author’s note] After playing this song with the chords I used to play for years,
only recently I realized that I’d been playing the wrong chords or in the wrong
key and that all the other previous submissions (of this song's tabs) here on
UG and other similar chords and tabs websites have been far from accurate
(except those versions that are different from the original version or are not
played in the original key, and either way I respect all tabs created out
there), so I made this one for some random awesomeness. Although, it’s an old
song, it’s what I used when I first tried learning to play the guitar so this is
unquestionably remarkable to me indeed. Huling El Bimbo will always be one of my
most favorite songs. :)

Song: Huling El Bimbo
Artist: Eraserheads
Tabbed by: Alnel Vincent T. Alico
Email: alnelextreme@yahoo.com

No capo

[ch]B[/ch]           x24442
[ch]D#m[/ch] or [ch]Ebm[/ch]  xx1342
[ch]C#[/ch] or [ch]Db[/ch]    x46664

Tip: All the parts except the refrains are played with the same chords
([ch]F#[/ch] [ch]G#7[/ch] [ch]B[/ch] [ch]F#[/ch]). Chords for the refrains are [ch]D#m[/ch] [ch]F#[/ch] [ch]B[/ch] [ch]C#[/ch].

[ch]E2[/ch]     079900

[ch]A[/ch]      x0765x (broken!)

[ch]E5[/ch]     022xxx (power)
/[ch]B[/ch]     x2xxxx (bass only)
/[ch]F#[/ch]    2xxxxx (bass only)
[ch]A5[/ch]     577xxx (power)
[ch]B5[/ch]     x244xx (power)


Notes/tips:
==> Sadly, di ko matuturo ung plucking na ginagawa ko dito. Improvise kau based on the chords sa mga
    plucking parts or bass from other tabs/video tutorials. Tulad ng broken B/A at A chords sa pre-chorus,
    plucking sila. Right before the chorus, ino-open pa actually ung B string sa dulong part ng ng A chord. 

==> Ang "E(2)", ibig sbhn, pwedeng E na lang gawin nyo, or kung mas sakto sa kanta, E2!

==> Karamihan ay non-standard chords. E lang ang normal. XD

==> para ma-mute ang D string sa A2/B sa intro, if u decide to do it, use the index finger pressing the
    A string to mute it. Same strategy sa A2/F#.

==> Pansin nyo, pag may "5" sa chord, ibig sbhn, un ung "power chord" version. At pag may "/", iba ung
    bass note. Pag slash lang, bass note lang pini-play.


More questions? Hanapin ako sa fb! :D


++Daryl Kayanan++
